document.docAuthor: Dupérré, Nadine, Tapia, Elicio, Quandt, Dietmar, Crespo-Pérez, Verónica & Harms, Danilo
document.docTitle: Masteria otongachi Duperre & Tapia 2021, new species
document.masterDocTitle: From the lowlands to the highlands of Ecuador, a study of the genus Masteria (Araneae, Mygalomorphae, Dipluridae) with description of seven new species

, new species

Esmeraldas ( -00.41941 -78.99607 )

.
Etymology. The specific name is a noun in apposition taken from the type locality Otongachi Natural Reserve.

Diagnosis. Males most resemble
M. lasdamas
n. sp. ,
but can be distinguished by their much larger size (4.41 vs. 2.69); prolateral process of leg I, P1 well sclerotized and triangular ( Fig. 23 C ) whilst P1 inconspicuous in
M. lasdamas
n. sp.
( Fig. 23B ).
Distribution. Ecuador : found at two localities in the Cotopaxi Province .
